translated: you went forth, giving up your dear son and wealth,
do not come under the control of mind.

analyzed: cittena vañcitā sattā  mārassa visaye ratā
translated: Beings deceived by mind,🔽delighting in Māra’s domain,
wander on the round of rebirths,
not knowing the end of suffering.

analyzed: sakkāya diṭṭhim eva ca  sīlabbata parāmāsa
translated: and also the view of (a real) self,🔽over-evaluation of (mere) rules and observances,
Having given up these fetters,🔽the nun
she will make an end to suffering.
Having put an end to the round of rebirths,
in this very life she will be free from longing,
